text: The Ego Has Landed is a compilation album by English singer Robbie Williams. After his success around the world, especially in Europe, The album was released in May 1999 in the United States and Canada, and later released worldwide. All tracks were previously released on Williams' first two albums, Life thru a Lens (1997) and I've Been Expecting You (1998). == Track listing == ==Notes== Tracks 1, 5, 7, 9, 10, and 14 are from Life thru a Lens (1997). Tracks 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 11, 12, and 13 are from I've Been Expecting You (1998). "One of God's Better People" runs 3:36. After 10 minutes of silence, Williams recites a poem called "Hello Sir", addressed to a teacher who berated him for wanting to become a pop singer. This previously appeared as a hidden track on Life thru a Lens. ==Reception== === Charts === ====Weekly charts==== Chart (1999) Peak position ====Year-end charts==== Chart (1999) Peak position New Zealand Albums (RMNZ)"End of Year Charts 1999" Recorded Music NZ. Retrieved 11 December 2017. 5 Chart (2000) Peak position New Zealand Albums (RMNZ) "End of Year Charts 2000" Recorded Music NZ. Retrieved 11 December 2017. 2 ===Certifications=== ==References== Category:Robbie Williams compilation albums
title: The Ego Has Landed
